title: Keynote Session : Yann LeCun, Executive Chairman, Advanced Machine Intelligence Labs
summary_one_liner: LeCun challenges conventional thinking on path to machine intelligence
icebreaker: Yann LeCun on self-supervised learning—which research direction excites you most?
networking_tip: Connect with PhD students and researchers—they influence next-gen AI talent hiring.

title: Keynote Session : Brad Smith, Vice Chair and President, Microsoft
summary_one_liner: Microsoft president on responsible AI governance and global partnerships
icebreaker: Brad Smith on AI governance—how does your org balance innovation with responsibility?
networking_tip: Policy advisors and CIOs cluster here. Discuss compliance and enterprise AI strategy.

title: Keynote Session : Demis Hassabis, Co-founder and CEO, Google DeepMind
summary_one_liner: DeepMind founder unveils breakthroughs at AI's scientific frontier
icebreaker: What's one real-world problem you'd solve with AlphaFold-level AI breakthroughs?
networking_tip: Biotech and pharma founders seek deep learning expertise—showcase your research chops.

title: Keynote Session : Julie Sweet, Chairperson and CEO, Accenture
summary_one_liner: Accenture CEO maps enterprise AI transformation roadmap globally
icebreaker: Julie Sweet on adoption—what's your biggest AI transformation bottleneck?
networking_tip: Consultants and Fortune 500 leaders need implementation partners—pitch solutions strategically.

title: Keynote Session : Alexandr Wang, Chief AI Officer, Meta
summary_one_liner: Meta's AI chief on open-source models and social AI scale
icebreaker: Alexandr Wang on open-source AI—how does transparency change your approach?
networking_tip: Open-source ML engineers cluster here—recruit talent passionate about collaborative AI.

title: Building India's next Decade of Innovation: The Role of Incubators, AI, and Innovation Missions
description: Explore how incubators, AI, and national innovation missions can power India's next decade of growth—by accelerating deep‑tech startups, scaling research to market, mobilizing talent and capital, and forging public‑private partnerships. Sessions highlight regional hubs, policy levers, funding models, and practical roadmaps for measurable economic and social impact.
room: Hall No. 4 First Floor - Session Hall 2
speakers: Sh. Prateek Deshmukh, Program Lead, AIM, NITI Aayog; Sh. Kavikrut, CEO, T-Hub; Sh. Kanishka Chatterjee, Managing Director; Sh. Dipanshu Parashar, Founder, Virtual Cyber Labs; Sh. Subodh Sachan, Director, STPI-HQ
summary_one_liner: Incubators and policy missions powering India's deep-tech startup wave
icebreaker: NITI Aayog and T-Hub are discussing growth—what deep-tech problem are you solving?
networking_tip: Government innovation officers and incubator directors have grant and partnership capital.

title: Keynote Session : Roy Jakobs, CEO, Philips
summary_one_liner: Philips CEO on AI revolutionizing healthcare delivery globally
icebreaker: Roy Jakobs is leading Philips into clinical AI—what's your biggest healthcare tech challenge?
networking_tip: Connect with fellow MedTech execs during breaks; healthcare AI deals often start with peer introductions.

title: Keynote Session : Martin Schroeter, Chairman and CEO, Kyndryl
summary_one_liner: Kyndryl CEO on AI-driven IT infrastructure modernization at scale
icebreaker: Martin Schroeter manages IT for enterprises globally—how's your hybrid cloud journey progressing?
networking_tip: Seek out Cloud Migration Architects; Kyndryl's managed services insights can unlock infrastructure partnerships.

title: Keynote Session : Jeet Adani, Director, Adani Digital Labs
summary_one_liner: Adani scion on AI powering India's infrastructure conglomerate
icebreaker: Jeet Adani's scaling AI across Adani Group—are you exploring industrial AI for conglomerates?
networking_tip: India's conglomerate executives attend here; discuss AI strategy alignment over coffee breaks.

title: Keynote Session : Olivier Blum, Global Chief Executive Officer, Schneider Electric
summary_one_liner: Schneider Electric CEO on AI for energy and sustainability
icebreaker: Olivier Blum on smart grids and sustainability—what's your enterprise's green tech priority?
networking_tip: Energy execs and CleanTech investors cluster together; position your AI solution for sustainability ROI.

title: Keynote Session : Arthur Mensch, CEO and Co-founder, Mistral AI
summary_one_liner: Mistral AI founder on European open-weight model innovation
icebreaker: Arthur Mensch built Mistral's open-weight models—what's your take on European AI sovereignty?
networking_tip: AI VCs and LLM researchers are highly concentrated here; demo your model or research strategically.

title: Keynote Session : Rajesh Subramanian, Chief Executive Officer, FedEx
summary_one_liner: FedEx CEO on AI transforming global logistics and supply chains
icebreaker: Rajesh Subramanian handles FedEx's supply chain AI—what logistics challenges does your tech solve?
networking_tip: Supply chain execs value peer case studies; discuss operational efficiency gains during networking sessions.

title: Keynote Session : Sanjay Mehrotra, CEO Micron
summary_one_liner: Micron CEO on memory and semiconductor infrastructure powering AI
icebreaker: Sanjay Mehrotra on memory chips for AI—are you building on HBM or next-gen compute infrastructure?
networking_tip: Hardware architects and chip designers dominate; technical depth helps credibility here.

title: Keynote Session : Nikesh Arora, CEO, Palo Alto Networks
summary_one_liner: Palo Alto Networks CEO on AI-powered cybersecurity at scale
icebreaker: Nikesh Arora leads Palo Alto's AI security—how's your threat detection keeping pace?
networking_tip: CISOs and security founders network intensely; lead with AI-powered detection capabilities.

title: Keynote Session : Ravi Kumar, CEO Cognizant
summary_one_liner: Cognizant CEO on AI-first digital services and workforce evolution
icebreaker: Ravi Kumar drives workforce upskilling at Cognizant—how are you reskilling teams for AI?
networking_tip: IT services leaders seek transformation playbooks; share your upskilling strategy during panels.

title: Keynote Session : Roshni Nadar Malhotra, Chairperson, HCLTech
summary_one_liner: HCLTech chairperson on engineering AI-first technology services
icebreaker: Roshni Nadar Malhotra champions women in tech—what's your engineering AI transformation strategy?
networking_tip: Women leaders and CTOs actively network here; authentic conversations on tech leadership drive partnerships.

title: Panel Discussion
speakers: Cina Lawson, Minister of Public Sector Efficiency & Digital Transformation, Togo; Nezar Patria, Vice Minister of Communications and Digital Affairs, Indonesia; Amr S. Talaat, Minister of Communications and Information Technology, Egypt; Debjani Ghosh, Distinguished Fellow, NITI Aayog
summary_one_liner: Global South ministers chart digital transformation policy roadmaps
icebreaker: What's the biggest digital transformation challenge Togo is tackling right now?
networking_tip: Connect with Minister Lawson on practical GovTech solutions—Global South officials often seek implementable case studies.

title: Panel Discussion
speakers: Paula Bogantes Zamora, Minister of Science, Innovation, Technology & Telecommunications, Costa Rica; Omar Al Olama, Minister of State for Artificial Intelligence, Digital Economy and Remote Work Applications, UAE; Sriram Krishnan, Senior Policy Advisor for AI, White House; Samir Saran, President, Observer Research Foundation
summary_one_liner: Top AI policymakers debate global governance and regulation frameworks
icebreaker: Sriram Krishnan—what's the White House's stance on AI regulation vs. innovation?
networking_tip: Ask Omar Al Olama about UAE's AI strategy—UAE officials actively source tech partnerships and talent.

title: Keynote Session : Rishi Sunak, Former PM, UK
summary_one_liner: Former UK PM shares lessons from AI Safety Summit leadership
icebreaker: How does Rishi Sunak see AI safety balancing with economic growth?
networking_tip: Position yourself near the keynote exit—heavy hitters often do brief 1:1s with engaged listeners.

title: Fireside Chat
speakers: Tony Blair, Executive Chairman, Tony Blair Institute for Global Change; Sonia Singh, Editorial Director and President, NDTV Ethics Committee
summary_one_liner: Tony Blair on AI governance and institutional reform worldwide
icebreaker: Tony Blair—how should institutions evolve to govern AI responsibly?
networking_tip: Mention a specific policy reform idea during Q&A to stand out to think tank fellows in attendance.

title: Keynote Session : Surya Ganguli, Professor (AI, Neuro, Physics), Stanford University
summary_one_liner: Stanford professor bridges AI, neuroscience, and physics foundations
icebreaker: Surya Ganguli—what's the biggest open question bridging neuroscience and deep learning?
networking_tip: Ask about research collaboration opportunities—Stanford neuroscience-AI researchers actively mentor early-career PhDs.

title: Keynote Session : Sundar Pichai
summary_one_liner: Google CEO unveils AI strategy shaping search, cloud, and beyond
icebreaker: What's Google's vision for Gemini in enterprise AI products?
networking_tip: Connect with Google product managers post-keynote—they actively recruit startup founders solving real problems.

title: AI for Economic Development and Social Good
description: This session will advance dialogue and collaboration among government, industry and the research community. It will explore AI's role in inclusive growth and sustainable innovation across manufacturing, agriculture, healthcare, and trustworthy AI. Featuring leadership talks, the session will convene leaders, policymakers, technologists and entrepreneurs to strengthen partnerships, promote R&D and accelerate responsible AI adoption.
speakers: Ashwini Vaishnaw; Dr. Anshuman Awasthi; Dr. Thomas Kuhn; H.E. Dr. Philipp Wildberger; Mr. Dattatri Salagame; Mr. Murali Nair; Mr. Prashanth Doreswamy; Ms. Anandi Iyer; Ms. Sindhu Gangadharan
summary_one_liner: Cross-sector leaders align AI for inclusive growth and social impact
icebreaker: Ashwini Vaishnaw's manufacturing AI focus—are you exploring AI for production efficiency or supply chain resilience?
networking_tip: Connect with gov officials during the breaks; they control budgets and procurement for AI4Good initiatives.

title: Democratizing AI Compute and Digital Data Infrastructures
description: This panel will examine how governments and partners can expand equitable access to the core enablers of AI ecosystems, particularly compute and digital data infrastructure to support inclusive, sustainable innovation. It will discuss practical models such as shared compute, regional infrastructure, and public–private partnerships, alongside investments in skills, data readiness, and governance. The panel will also explore cost-efficient AI approaches and strategies to reduce AI's environmental footprint through energy- and water-efficient infrastructure.
speakers: Chenai Chair; Faith Waithaka; Ronnie Chatterji; Sangbu Kim; Sanjay Jain; Saurabh Garg; Yan LeCun
summary_one_liner: World Bank-backed panel tackles equitable access to AI compute
icebreaker: With Yan LeCun on the panel, what's your take on whether open-source models can truly democratize AI compute?
networking_tip: Target infrastructure policy makers—they're rare at events and deciding budgets for compute access projects.

title: Building AI Readiness: From Compute to Capability
description: The proliferation of Generative AI, driven by the advent of Large Language Models (LLMs), Visual Language Models (VLMs), and Agentic workflows, has fundamentally transformed the requirements for high-performance computing infrastructure. For the users of the IndiaAI compute portal and the broader ecosystem, the selection of Graphics Processing Units (GPUs) has evolved from a simple metric of peak floating-point performance (FLOPS) into a complex optimization challenge involving memory bandwidth, interconnect topology, and architectural specialization.
speakers: Thomas Zacharia; Timothy Robson
summary_one_liner: Deep dive into GPU selection and HPC infrastructure for AI
icebreaker: Are you optimizing for LLM inference speed or training efficiency in your current GPU setup?
networking_tip: ML engineers cluster by company; identify the infrastructure team's table and join their technical discussion.

title: India's Path to an AGI-Enabling Ecosystem
description:
This session brings together perspectives on what it takes to 
create an ecosystem capable of supporting frontier-scale AI research in 
India. Speakers from compute and energy infrastructure, academia and industry will discuss the conditions required for long-horizon research, 
large-scale experimentation and the development of all five layers of the AI 
infrastructure. The discussion will highlight how human capital 
development, strengthening science ecosystems, and democratizing AI resources will advance AI development in India.
speakers: Parth Sarthi; Suvrat Bhooshan
summary_one_liner: Building India's five-layer AI infrastructure for frontier research
icebreaker: What's the biggest infrastructure bottleneck you see for frontier AI research in India right now?
networking_tip: Deep-tech founders and infrastructure investors attend—use this to scout co-founder or investor matches.

title: Collaborative Network on AI
description: AI holds significant promise for socio-economic transformation across agriculture, healthcare, and education, yet access to data, compute, and models remains uneven. This session will explore how a collaborative research and innovation network bridge capabilities across regions. The discussion will examine shared research, real-world testing across diverse contexts, and sustained knowledge exchange to scale practical, inclusive AI-for-good solutions globally.
speakers: Beatriz Vasconcellos; Keyzom N. Massally; Prem Kumar; Rudra Chaudhuri; Shalini Kapoor; Shankar Maruwada
summary_one_liner: Global South coalition building shared AI research for social impact
icebreaker: How is your organization bridging the compute access gap for AI4Good projects in emerging markets?
networking_tip: International development experts drive funding; exchange contacts during the collaborative network segment.

title: MahaAI: Building Safe, Secure and Smart Governance
description: This session will showcase Maharashtra's approach to building safe, secure and citizen-centric AI governance. It will examine how the State is embedding ethics, data protection, security and AI system for public services, safety and administration. The discussion will outline Maharashtra's policy roadmap for responsible AI adoption and highlight how AI can drive economic growth and social good while remaining transparent, accountable and trusted.
speakers: Davinder Sandhu; Dr. Amit Kapoor,; Dr. Anupam Chattopadhyay; Dr. Ganesh Ramakrishnan; Mr. Ashish Tewari; Mr. Bhuvnesh Kumar; Mr. Devroop Dhar; Mr. Ranjeet Goswami; Mr. Suresh Sethi; Mr. Vikas Rastogi
summary_one_liner: Maharashtra's AI governance blueprint for citizen-centric public services
icebreaker: What ethical safeguards is your organization building into AI governance, inspired by Maharashtra's model?
networking_tip: GovTech founders and state officials attend—pitch smart city solutions during the governance showcase.

title: AI at the Core, 6G at the Edge: Designing India's Next Resilient, Innovative and Efficient Digital Frontier
description: The panel discussion situates India's opportunity at the intersection of these two forces: AI providing cognition, autonomy, and predictive intelligence, while 6G provides real-time sensing, extreme reliability, and pervasive connectivity across terrestrial, aerial, maritime, and satellite systems. In this emerging paradigm, networks themselves become AI-native—the radio interface, the RAN, the core, and the edge begin to reason, adapt, self-organize, and optimize through multi-agent intelligence
speakers: Radhakant Das; Rajesh Kumar Pathak; Sandeep Sharma; Sanjay Nekkanti
summary_one_liner: AI-native 6G networks enabling India's next digital frontier
icebreaker: How does 6G's edge computing actually change AI deployment compared to current cloud-centric models?
networking_tip: Telecom and 6G researchers are niche—focus on side conversations to build relationships with rare expertise.

title: Blueprint to Accelerate India's AI Success
description:
India is at a pivotal stage in its AI journey, aiming to become a global innovation hub. This session will unveil the "Blueprint to Accelerate India's AI Growth", outlining priorities across Invest, Innovate, and Evolve; scaling infrastructure, building skills, enabling indigenous innovation, and ensuring trusted governance. The session will convene leaders to discuss how the Blueprint
can advance AI readiness, drive economic growth, and promote social good, supporting India's vision for inclusive and sustainable AI leadership.
speakers: Hon'ble Shri Jayant Chaudhary Ji; Manish Gupta; Mridu Bhandari; Rajgopal A S; Rajiv Memani; Rishi Bal; Vivek Mohindra
summary_one_liner: Dell-backed blueprint for India's AI readiness and economic growth
icebreaker: Which pillar of India's AI Blueprint resonates most with your organization's growth strategy?
networking_tip: High-level gov officials and enterprise CIOs present; use structured Q&A to gain visibility, then network during breaks.

title: Scaling Human Potential in the Age of AI
description: AI is rapidly becoming a foundational layer across education, creativity, and enterprise. This session examines how human potential is shaped, scaled, or constrained by AI systems and what it takes to ensure these technologies expand capability rather than concentrate advantage. Leaders from automation, AI-driven enterprise, data ecosystems, global business, philanthropy, and the creative arts discuss where AI meaningfully augments human skill, and where intentional design is required to prevent new forms of exclusion.
speakers: Anurag Hoon; Archana Vemulapalli; Kirthiga Reddy; Lakshmi Pratury; Mihir Shukla; Radha Ramaswami Basu
summary_one_liner: Leaders debate whether AI expands or concentrates human opportunity
icebreaker: How is your team balancing AI augmentation with preserving human creativity and decision-making?
networking_tip: CHROs and EdTech founders seek talent solutions—position your upskilling initiatives prominently during discussions.

title: The Innovation Beneath AI: The U-India Partnership powering the AI Era
description: AI is driving a creative destruction in how the world builds infrastructure, including energy, critical minerals, compute, and data centres. Countries are increasingly building this together, reflected in policy signals around rare earth supply chains and large-scale investments in clean energy to support AI. Entrepreneurs and early-stage backers are supporting the next wave of large-scale infrastructure builds, while national AI strategies continue to shape the broader direction of development.
speakers: Abhishek Singh; Jeff Binder; Tobias Helbig; Tuan Ho; Ujjwal Kumar; Vrushali Gaud
summary_one_liner: US-India partnership powering AI-era energy and compute infrastructure
icebreaker: Abhishek Singh's take on US-India critical minerals strategy—where do you see the biggest infrastructure gaps?
networking_tip: Target energy infrastructure execs during breaks; they're decision-makers who influence bilateral trade deals and funding flows.

title: Governing Scientific AI at Scale: Safety, Evaluation, and Institutional Readiness
description: As capabilities scale, existing assurance and risk management approaches are often stretched by real-world scientific and institutional contexts. This session examines how safety, evaluation, governance frameworks can be adapted and stress-tested through scientific AI use cases, and how emerging ecosystems can build evaluation capacity, manage high-impact risks, and contribute to globally robust scientific AI safety practices.
speakers: Dr. Geetha Raju; Dr. Suryesh Kumar Namdeo; PT Nhean; Shyam Krishna
summary_one_liner: Stress-testing AI safety frameworks for high-stakes scientific applications
icebreaker: Dr. Geetha Raju mentioned institutional readiness for scientific AI—what evaluation frameworks work in your context?
networking_tip: Safety researchers cluster together; position yourself near Dr. Suryesh Kumar's discussion to join deep technical conversations.

title: पढ़AI 2.0: Reimagining Indian Education System
description: This session explores a bold vision of education in the age of AI, moving beyond incremental adoption to reimagine entire learning ecosystems. Drawing on global ideas and international best practices, it treats AI as a transformative force shaping pedagogy, assessment, institutions, and educator roles. The discussion encourages imaginative, future-oriented thinking around learner-centric, inclusive, human-centred models that use AI to enable personalised learning, creativity, and lifelong learning at scale for learners, teachers, and systems worldwide, equitably.
speakers: Alondra Nelson; Anand Rao Patil; Pankaj Arora; Pranav Gupta; Yogesh Singh
knowledge_partners: Center of Policy Research and Governance
summary_one_liner: Reimagining India's education with AI-powered personalized learning at scale
icebreaker: Alondra Nelson's vision for personalized learning—how are you thinking about AI pedagogy in your school or platform?
networking_tip: EdTech founders and policy makers attend; chat with school administrators early—they're less networked but make adoption decisions.

title: Welfare for All: Ensuring Equitable AI Growth Across the World's Largest and Oldest Democracies
description: This high-level panel will convene World's largest AI practitioners from Google, Apple, Microsoft, Dell, and others will explore how the world's biggest tech companies can work with governments to achieve democratic access to AI on a global scale. With India and the U.S. as democratic anchors, the session will highlight practical pathways to ensure AI-driven growth delivers broad-based welfare and equal opportunity for all.
speakers: Mr. Brad Staples; Mr. Julian Waits; Mr. Michael Sellitto; Mr. Wilson White
summary_one_liner: Big Tech and governments align AI for democratic welfare
icebreaker: Brad Staples from a Big Tech company—curious how you're approaching equitable AI access in emerging markets?
networking_tip: High-density decision-makers; arrive early to catch policy advisors before the main panel—they influence procurement and partnerships.

title: Agentic AI Roundtable
description: This roundtable will convene senior industry leaders and government officials to examine governance, interoperability, and responsible deployment challenges posed by emerging agentic AI systems capable of autonomous decision-making and adaptive behaviour. Grounded in real-world use cases, the discussion will focus on cybersecurity, enterprise productivity, and autonomous systems. Participants will explore risk-based governance, secure-by-design principles, and the role of open, industry-led technical standards in enabling safe, scalable, and interoperable agentic AI across borders.
speakers: Caroline Louveaux; Daniel Castro; Danielle Gilliam-Moore; Jason Oxman; Mohak Shroff; Prith Banerjee; Sam Kaplan; Syam Nair
summary_one_liner: Industry leaders tackle governance of autonomous AI agents
icebreaker: Sam Kaplan, what governance patterns are you seeing across agentic AI deployments right now?
networking_tip: Senior executives dominate; focus on the CXOs during Q&A—roundtable format lets you approach speakers directly after sessions.

title: AI and Open Networks: Creating Impact at Scale
description: AI can deliver population-scale impact across healthcare, education, agriculture, and energy only when coordination is built into the system through Open Networks and Digital Public Infrastructure. In India, AI agents leveraging open networks already help citizens access vital services via simple mobile interfaces—demonstrating how this model bridges structural gaps in service delivery. This session examines how this interoperable infrastructure translates AI intent into action, enabling safe, privacy-preserving impact that can scale across borders.
speakers: Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw; Mr. James Manyika; Nandan Nilekani; Sangbu Kim; Sunil Wadhwani
summary_one_liner: Open networks turn AI into population-scale public services
icebreaker: Nandan Nilekani on open networks—how are you thinking about interoperability for healthcare or agriculture AI?
networking_tip: Series B+ founders and DPI architects here; find the health/agriculture founders—they're solving population-scale problems and raising capital.

title: Rightsizing Governance in an AI-Driven World
description: This panel explores how India and partner nations can use AI for real-world impact, bridge digital divides, and support inclusive growth. Aligned with the UK–India strategic tech partnership, it shows how global forums can turn shared ambition into action on AI governance and deployment. The discussion covers shared compute and data, support for smaller states, and high-impact collaboration across healthcare, education, and climate for responsible AI at scale.
speakers: Isabella Wilkinson; Melika Carroll; Navrina Singh; Raffi Krikorian; Rajesh Nambiar; Sabina Ciofu
summary_one_liner: UK-India partnership blueprints inclusive AI governance at scale
icebreaker: Raffi Krikorian's work on digital divides—where's the biggest opportunity in shared compute infrastructure right now?
networking_tip: Diplomats and policy makers from multiple countries attend; talk to NGO leaders between sessions—they know gaps in inclusive growth.

title: Scaling Climate Solutions: Data, AI, and India's Energy Transformation
description: Open data and AI can significantly strengthen climate resilience and help India meet its net zero target by 2070 and 500 GW renewable capacity by 2030. Achieving this requires faster digital transformation across climate and energy institutions and stronger Climate AI talent to break silos. This session convenes experts to examine the building blocks of a climate-energy data ecosystem, showcasing real-world use cases
speakers: Akhilesh Magal; Dr. Cormekki Whitley; Dr. Neelanjan Sircar; Dr. Priya Donti; Karan Shah; Priyank Hirani; Swetha Ravi Kumar
summary_one_liner: AI and open data accelerate India's net-zero energy transition
icebreaker: Dr. Priya Donti on climate resilience—what data challenges are blocking your net zero roadmap?
networking_tip: Climate tech founders and clean energy investors present; sit near sustainability officers—they allocate budgets and know investor networks.

title: Beyond Technicality: Multidisciplinary AI Governance for Real-World Impact
description: This interactive roundtable broadens the AI safety conversation by foregrounding societal, institutional, and ethical dimensions beyond purely technical approaches. It treats AI governance as a multidisciplinary, context-aware challenge rooted in real deployment settings and community experience. Through brief interventions and guided discussion, participants will identify shared priorities and co-develop principles and collaboration areas to embed interdisciplinary expertise, civil society voices, and context-sensitive evaluation into national and global AI policy frameworks.
speakers: Dame Wendy Hall; James (Kayliang) Ong; Jeanna Matthews; Jibu Elias; John Harvard; Merve Hickok; Neha Kumar; Quentin Lambert; Sara Hooker; Virginia Dignum
summary_one_liner: Multidisciplinary voices reshape AI safety beyond technical fixes
icebreaker: Sara Hooker bringing civil society into AI safety—how are you embedding ethics into governance at your org?
networking_tip: Multidisciplinary group with academics, ethicists, and policymakers; the roundtable format encourages cross-sector collaboration—sit strategically.

title: AI for India's Digital Public Infrastructure and Industrial Future
description: As India enters its next phase of AI-driven digital growth, telecom networks are becoming the intelligent backbone of Digital Public Infrastructure (DPI). This session explores how AI-native networks, edge computing, and interoperable standards can strengthen trust, resilience, and digital sovereignty. The discussion will examine the convergence of telecom, AI, and DPI, and how India can play a leadership role in shaping globally compatible architectures in driving consensus across the mobile ecosystem.
speakers: Ambika Khurana; Debashish Chakraborty; Deepak Maheshwari; Mansi Kedia; Rahul Vatts
summary_one_liner: Telecom-AI convergence powers India's sovereign digital infrastructure
icebreaker: Deepak Maheshwari on AI-native telecom networks—how are you architecting edge computing for DPI?
networking_tip: Telecom executives and 5G strategists; connect with DPI architects early—they're evaluating vendors and hiring engineering talent.

title: AI Literacy and Building for Children in a Digital Age
description: The pace of AI can feel overwhelming and, rightly, increasing attention is being given to minimizing its negative impacts on children. However, it is not enough for children to simply adapt to AI - they also need foundational competencies to understand, engage with and critically assess the systems of the future. Experts will discuss approaches to AI literacy and explore how to build empowering technology for children.
speakers: ​Atish Joshua Gonsalves; Dr. Saadhna Panday; Richa Menke; Tom Hall
summary_one_liner: Empowering children with AI literacy and critical digital skills
icebreaker: Atish, how do you help kids actually understand AI without scaring parents?
networking_tip: Chat with K-12 designers during breaks—they're building curricula and need edtech solutions now.

title: Multistakeholder Partnerships for Thriving AI Ecosystems
description: This session demonstrates how multi-stakeholder collaboration on Responsible AI builds inclusive ecosystems and advances sustainable development across health, education, climate resilience, and public sector innovation. It showcases scalable partnership models—such as blended finance, compute sharing, open data, and capacity building—reviews progress since the Hamburg Declaration on Responsible AI for the SDGs, and identifies actionable pathways for future collaboration and impact.
speakers: Dr. Bärbel Kofler; Nakul Jain; Robert Opp; Srini Tallapragada
knowledge_partners: German Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development (BMZ)
summary_one_liner: Global partnerships mobilize responsible AI for sustainable development
icebreaker: What does Nakul Jain see as the biggest bottleneck in blended finance for AI in emerging markets?
networking_tip: Target impact investors early—they make funding decisions fast and attend opening sessions.

title: Responsible AI in Action: How Global Enterprises Are Building Trust at Scale
description: AI is reshaping industries worldwide, and trust plays an important role in enabling sustainable innovation. This session will bring together AI leaders and decision-makers to discuss approaches to responsible AI deployment at scale. The discussion will examine how enterprises are embedding ethics, transparency, and accountability into mission-critical AI systems while balancing speed, compliance, and innovation. Participants will gain insights, strategies, and real-world examples related to building safe and trusted AI systems.
speakers: Mr. Ankit Bose; Mr. Manish Gupta; Mr. Sunil Abraham; Mr. Syed Ahmed; Ms.  Geeta Gurnani
summary_one_liner: Enterprises embed ethics and transparency into production AI systems
icebreaker: Ankit, how do enterprises actually measure trust in their AI systems at scale?
networking_tip: Find CXOs near coffee stations between sessions—they're thinking about enterprise deals.

title: AI and Workforce Transformation: India's Roadmap to Global Competitiveness
description: This session will explore how AI is reshaping jobs, skills, and productivity, and how India can convert this disruption into a strategic advantage. It will examine the evolving AI skills landscape and discuss how to build inclusive, AI-native talent pipelines through skilling, reskilling, vernacular learning, and stronger industry–academia collaboration. Bringing together policymakers, industry leaders, academia, and SMEs, the session will also highlight role of private industry in positioning India as a globally competitive hub for AI talent.
speakers: Mr Ravi Aurora; Mr Srikrishna Ramakarthikeyan; Mr Vishnu R Dusad; Ms Sangeeta Gupta
summary_one_liner: India builds AI-native talent pipelines for global competitiveness
icebreaker: Sangeeta, which AI skills gaps are CHROs struggling to fill in India right now?
networking_tip: Connect with SME owners in smaller breakout sessions—they hire and need practical training partners.

title:
Building
Blocks for National AI Strategy and Implementation
description: This high-impact conference unites global AI leaders—disruptors, VCs, practitioners, and national decision-makers—to exchange real-world strategies for scaling AI responsibly. Sessions feature report launches like "Great Powers in the Age of AI," tackling geopolitical roles, enterprise transformations, and national ecosystem challenges (data/compute/talent gaps). Moderated panels explore governance transitions, India's leadership potential, and pathways for secure, equitable innovation across Industrial-to-Information Age dynamics.
speakers: Atsushi Yamanka; Dr. Hoda Baraka; Kavita Bhatia; Laura Gilbert; Phani Nagarjuna; Saibal Chakraborty; Suha Kayum
summary_one_liner: National leaders share real playbooks for scaling AI responsibly
icebreaker: Dr. Hoda, how should countries balance compute sovereignty with global AI advancement?
networking_tip: VCs cluster near keynotes—approach them with specific policy-tech angles right after talks end.

title: The Role of Science in International AI Governance
description:
Scientific knowledge is an essential foundation for effective governance of Artificial
Intelligence. As AI systems evolve, there is a growing need for transparent and evidence-
based assessments to guide international standards and ensure inclusive innovation.
This session will explore how the science-policy interface can inform international AI
governance and strengthen cooperation between stakeholders.
speakers: Ajay Kumar Sood; Amandeep Gill; Anil Ananthaswamy; Anne Bouverot; António Guterres; Balaraman Ravindran; Brad Smith; Josephine Teo; Soumya Swaminathan; Yoshua Bengio
knowledge_partners: United Nations Office for Digital and Emerging Technologies
summary_one_liner: Top global leaders forge science-driven international AI governance
icebreaker: Yoshua Bengio, what scientific evidence do policymakers most misunderstand about AI safety?
networking_tip: This is a heavy-hitter event—arrive early to secure time with Heads of State and UN delegates.

title: AI in Negotiations, Diplomacy, and Conflict Management
description: AI research spans domains from scientific discovery to financial markets, yet attempts to develop, evaluate, and deploy AI in negotiations and diplomatic settings remain sparse. This session will examine efforts in the AI in Negotiation, Diplomacy, and Conflict Management (NDCM) space, urging participants to rethink these tools and imagine a future in which non-human intelligence plays a trusted role in international negotiations.
speakers: Carme Artigas,; Gabriela Ramos; J. Michael McQuade
knowledge_partners: The Move37 Project at the Belfer Center for Science and International Affairs, Harvard Kennedy School
summary_one_liner: Exploring AI's trusted role in diplomacy and conflict resolution
icebreaker: J. Michael McQuade, can AI actually help resolve conflicts or does it just predict them?
networking_tip: Diplomats prefer structured networking—attend official receptions to build credible relationships.

title: Heterogeneous Compute for Democratizing Access to AI: From Workload Awareness to Scalable Deployment
description: This practitioner-led session will discuss how to address critical challenge of making AI economically viable and globally accessible by moving beyond the "GPU-only" paradigm to strategic, workload-aware compute architectures. Featuring technology leaders alongside government stakeholders, panel will demonstrate how matching AI workloads to the right hardware mix—CPUs, NPUs, TPUs, and GPUs—can reduce costs while maintaining performance i.e., maximize RoI. The discussion focuses on practical deployment strategies, from edge-cloud orchestration to real-world placement decisions.
speakers: Bhawna Agarwal; Daisy Chittilapilly; Dr. Ambica Rajagopal; Dr. Durga Malladi; Gokul Subramaniam; Kazim Rizvi; Prof. Kamakoti V., Padma Shree; Srini Iyengar
summary_one_liner: Beyond GPUs: workload-aware compute slashes AI costs at scale
icebreaker: Prof. Kamakoti, beyond GPUs, which hardware does your team see as the next AI bottleneck?
networking_tip: ML engineers cluster in technical tracks—grab infrastructure architects during hands-on sessions.

title: Safe and Trusted AI, AI for Economic Growth and Social Good, Inclusion for Social Empowerment
description: This session convenes diverse stakeholders to exchange perspectives on building trustworthy and socially beneficial AI. It focuses on practical safeguards, shared accountability, capacity building, and alignment around good practices that support innovation while protecting people and communities, encouraging cooperation and actionable pathways for responsible AI adoption.
speakers: Alexandria Walden; Ankit Bose; Hector De Rivoire; Namit Agarwal; Paridhi Adani; Paula Goldman; Peggy Hicks; Youchul Kim
summary_one_liner: UN human rights lens on safe and socially beneficial AI
icebreaker: Paula Goldman, how do you balance AI safety guardrails with enabling innovation?
networking_tip: Human rights and CSR leaders prefer intimate discussions—book 1-on-1s before the event.

title: Trustworthy AI for All: Democratizing AI Resources Across the Stack
description: Many countries are developing strategies for sovereign AI capabilities. Not all nations, especially LMICs, can have total control of the supply chain for their own AI stack. Such nations need the ability to have agency and control of their own AI. This panel will discuss the requirements for sovereign AI, the role private and public organisations play in delivering this, and the mechanisms that can be deployed to ensure a trustworthy and responsible AI stack.
speakers: Carsten Maple; Dame Professor Wendy Hall; Dr Peter Mattson; Dr Saurabh Garg; Harish Iyer; Natasha Crampton
summary_one_liner: Sovereign AI stacks for low-income countries via global cooperation
icebreaker: Dame Wendy Hall, what does a realistic sovereign AI strategy look like for LMICs?
networking_tip: Gov and LMIC officials attend panels—approach them with specific technical solutions post-session.

title: Scaling Trusted AI: How France and India Are Building Industrial & Innovation Bridges
description: This flagship Indo-French session brings together government and industry leaders to advance trusted, responsible, and scalable AI. Featuring keynote visions from India and France, moderated dialogues, and a high-level panel, the event focuses on AI infrastructure, industrial deployment, deep tech, and sovereign data systems. It strengthens bilateral policy alignment, catalyses industry partnerships, and accelerates joint R&D, positioning the India AI Summit as a premier global platform for AI cooperation and innovation.
speakers: Frederic Lelong; Naila Giovanni
summary_one_liner: Indo-French AI alliance targets industrial deployment and deep tech
icebreaker: Frederic, what's the biggest sovereign data challenge France sees in Indo-French AI partnerships?
networking_tip: Target the R&D Directors and Deep Tech Founders during moderated dialogue breaks—high decision-maker density means real deals happen here.

title: Digital Ministers' / Senior Officials' Roundtable on the International AI Safety Report
description: AI capabilities outpace the evidence-base on impacts and safeguards, creating a dilemma for policymakers: How to act early enough to reduce risk while ensuring progress of effective approaches? Global experts will present and discuss the key findings of the International AI Safety Report, an initiative backed by 30+ countries and international organizations, providing a science-based understanding of general-purpose AI capabilities, emerging risks, and mitigation measures.
speakers: Adam Beaumont; Alondra Nelson; Josephine Teo; Lee Tiedrich; Yoshua Bengio
summary_one_liner: Ministers debate global AI safety report findings and policy action
icebreaker: Yoshua Bengio's work on safety is foundational—what's your biggest concern translating his research into policy?
networking_tip: Arrive early to the roundtable. With Josephine Teo and ministers present, intimate access happens before formal remarks start.

title: AI Beyond Moonshots: A Playbook for Many
description: As India advances from AI strategy to economy-wide adoption, the challenge is translating digital foundations into measurable AI diffusion across sectors, regions, and populations. This session explores how to convert AI readiness into tangible outcomes—driving productivity, inclusion, and competitiveness while offering a scalable model for the Global South. Leaders will discuss moving from pilots to scaled deployment, leveraging policy instruments, financing mechanisms, and India's digital public infrastructure to unlock AI's transformative potential.
speakers: Abhineet Kaul; Brando Benifei; Doreen Bogdan-Martin; Dr. Rachel Adams; Frederic Werner
summary_one_liner: From AI pilots to economy-wide adoption across the Global South
icebreaker: How is Doreen Bogdan-Martin's ITU perspective shaping AI diffusion strategy in your region?
networking_tip: Global South leaders cluster together—position yourself near development finance conversations where sector-wide adoption deals form.

title: The Agent Universe: From Automation to Autonomy
description: This session explores software's shift from passive tools to autonomous, goal-driven agents—where agency replaces interfaces. Key signals include machine-first platforms, "login as agent" paradigms, and intent-driven workflows transforming commerce, governance, and productivity. The session spotlights India's leadership through scale, digital infrastructure, and talent; and encourages audiences to rethink who—or what—powers the future of computing.
speakers: Harinder Takhar; Vijay Shekhar Sharma
summary_one_liner: Paytm's vision of autonomous AI agents replacing software interfaces
icebreaker: Vijay Shekhar Sharma built Paytm on fintech—how's he seeing agents reshape digital commerce?
networking_tip: AI Platform Engineers and Founders will discuss architecture in hallway conversations—these aren't polished elevator pitches but real technical vetting.

title: Building Public Interest AI: Catalytic Funding for Equitable Access to Compute Resources
description: This event will mark the launch of the working report on "Opening Up Computational Resources for New AI Futures" by Secretary, MOSPI in the presence of Additional Secretary, MeitY. The event includes a keynote and a panel discussion that brings together senior govt officials and global AI experts to discuss pathways for democratising AI. How will catalytic funding for public interest and South–South partnerships democratise access and affordability of compute in the Global South?
speakers: Abhishek Singh; Andrew Sweet; Deepali Khanna; Dr. Saurabh Garg; Martin Tisné; Shaun Seow; Shikoh Gitau; Sushant Kumar; Vilas Dhar
knowledge_partners: The Rockefeller Foundation and Kalpa Impact
summary_one_liner: Rockefeller Foundation launches report on democratizing AI compute access
icebreaker: Vilas Dhar and the Rockefeller Foundation are launching compute access—what does equitable AI infrastructure look like for your sector?
networking_tip: Impact Investors and Development Finance Officers attend this. Pitch your Global South AI project to the right table immediately after the report launch.

title: Regulatory Pathway for AI-Driven Medical Devices: Bridging Training, Validation, and Clinical Evaluation
description: This session is being convened to align the development, validation, and deployment of AI-enabled medical devices with India's evolving regulatory landscape. The session will examine AI-SiMD and AI-SaMD across the full lifecycle, including data quality, algorithm training, change management, technical and clinical validation, human oversight, and patient safety. Leveraging particular ongoing reasearch initiatives and draft guidance, it will foster informed, multi-stakeholder dialogue to support safe, effective, and regulation-compliant AI adoption.
speakers: Aseem Sahu; Dr Krithika Rangarajan; Dr. Rajiv Bahl; Dr. Taruna Madan; Rado Andrian; Vibhav Mithal
knowledge_partners: Indian Council of Medical Research Headquarters, New Delhi
summary_one_liner: India charts regulatory pathways for AI-powered medical devices
icebreaker: Dr. Rajiv Bahl chairs ICMR—how is India's regulatory sandbox accelerating AI-SiMD validation timelines?
networking_tip: Clinical Researchers and Regulatory Affairs Officers need each other here. Volunteer for breakout discussions—high technical depth means focused, quality conversations.

title: Empowering People in the Age of AI: German–Asian Partnerships for Talent, Innovation, and the Future of Work
description: This panel explores how German–Asian cooperation bridges AI skill gaps to drive SME productivity and innovation. Experts will discuss strategic partnerships between government, industry, and academia to integrate vocational training with AI-led ecosystems. By showcasing collaboration models like the AI Academia Innovation Partnership, the session offers actionable pathways for preparing a future-ready workforce and securing long-term competitiveness in an AI-driven global economy.
speakers: Arthur Rapp; Dr Kusumita Arora; Dr. Baerbel Kofler; Mr. Augustus Azariah; Mr. Jan Noether; Prof. Dr. Clas Neumann
knowledge_partners: German Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development (BMZ)
summary_one_liner: German-Asian AI skilling partnerships boost SME productivity globally
icebreaker: Dr. Kusumita Arora, what SME productivity gains are German-Asian partnerships unlocking through AI skills training?
networking_tip: Workforce Development and Vocational Training Leaders are your core audience—these roles control budgets and hiring decisions across sectors.

title: AI Solutions for Climate Resilience: Scaling Innovation and Efficiency
description: This session will outline the potential of AI solutions in addressing  both climate resilience and mitigation. Leaders from academia, industry and international agencies will discuss practical AI frameworks and solutions across resilience challenges as well as mitigation verticals including energy systems, the built environment, sustainable agriculture and horizontals such as supply chains and materials innovation.
speakers: Adam Sobey; Dan Travers; Dr. Robert Thompson; Mark Patel; Nalin Agarwal; Prof. David Sandalow; Siddharth Singh; Spencer Low; Uday Khemka; Vrushali Goud
summary_one_liner: Practical AI frameworks tackle climate resilience and clean energy
icebreaker: Uday Khemka's been scaling climate-tech deals—what AI frameworks are energy systems and agriculture actually adopting?
networking_tip: Climate Tech Founders and Impact Investors both attend—grab Uday or Prof. Sandalow during coffee; they fund and advise simultaneously.

title: Breaking Barriers: Multilingual AI as a Bridge to Democratic Access
description: AI's potential remains limited if it serves only a narrow set of languages, which may deepen digital divides. This panel highlights how multilingual AI can broaden access to technology. It showcases an open-source multilingual AI model and its real-world applications, emphasizing collaboration to advance public-interest AI and inclusive innovation.
speakers: Ayah Bdeir; Dr. Amitabh Nag; Katharina Frey; Markus Reubi; PD Dr. Alex Ilic; Prof. Dr. Annie Hartley; Prof. Dr. Petri Myllymäki; Prof. Jon Wilson; Prof. Torsten Schwede
knowledge_partners: Swiss Federal Department of Foreign Affairs FDFA
summary_one_liner: Open-source multilingual AI models bridge global language divides
icebreaker: Prof. Dr. Petri Myllymäki, how's multilingual AI closing the digital divide in underserved language communities?
networking_tip: NLP researchers and Open Source Contributors cluster here—contribute to a live discussion or show working code; expertise visibility matters more than small talk.

title: AI for the Good of All - Brazilian Perspectives on the Future of AI
description: The event will present Brazil's priorities and vision for artificial intelligence, with a focus on development, innovation, inclusion, sustainability, and public trust. The session will bring together high-level representatives from the Brazilian government to share experiences in public policy, digital transformation, and international governance, exploring solutions that generate concrete benefits for society while ensuring transparency, security, and ethical standards. It will provide a broad overview of the opportunities to build AI for the good of all, grounded in Brazil's approach.
speakers: Esther Dweck; Eugênio Vargas Garcia; Hugo Valadares; Luanna Sant'Anna Roncaratti; Luciana Santos
knowledge_partners: Brazil's Ministry of Foreign Affairs (MRE), Embassy of Brazil in New Delhi
summary_one_liner: Brazil showcases national AI vision for inclusive digital transformation
icebreaker: Esther Dweck, what's Brazil prioritizing first—AI development, inclusion, or public trust in governance?
networking_tip: LATAM policy makers and diplomats attend. Pitch trade/investment partnerships during the sustainability discussion segment.

title: Global AI Capacity Development Network
description: The session introduces the Global Network of Centres for Exchange and Cooperation on AI Capacity Building, a new collaborative initiative to align global capacity-building efforts, mobilize resources and strengthen countries' ability to participate meaningfully in the AI ecosystem. During the session, high-level panelists will discuss the role of a networked approach to complement and contribute to capacity-building efforts on artificial intelligence in the context of the establishment of the Global Dialogue on Artificial Intelligence Governance.
speakers: Amandeep Singh Gill; Anne Marie Engtoft Meldgaard; B. Ravindran; Mr. H.E. Mr. Rein Tammsaar; Mrs. Egriselda López; Seydina Moussa Ndiaye; Vilas Dhar
knowledge_partners: United Nations Office for Digital and Emerging Technologies
summary_one_liner: UN launches global network for AI capacity building cooperation
icebreaker: Amandeep Singh Gill's work on UN AI governance—what capacity gaps is your country prioritizing first?
networking_tip: High-density decision makers: arrive early to connect with UN delegates and gov officials before panel discussions begin.

title: Beyond Proof of Concepts: Using 4D-AI to Build Sovereign, Sustainable and Responsible AI at Production Scale
description: A fast paced, practical session for government and industry leaders who need AI that works in production—not just in pilots. Join us to explore the four dimensions of Trusted AI and discover actionable strategies for scaling secure, responsible, and sovereign AI across the globe.
speakers: Omeed Hashim; Theresa Yurkewich Hoffmann
summary_one_liner: From AI pilots to production-scale sovereign deployment strategies
icebreaker: Omeed Hashim covered 4D-AI in production—what's your biggest blocker moving from pilot to scale?
networking_tip: Target DevOps and enterprise architect attendees during Q&A; they're hands-on and make real buying decisions.

title: How Non-Profits are using AI-based Innovations to Scale Impact
description: Join social sector leaders for a grounded look at a six-month AI Cohort Program. Featuring insights from seven NGOs, this session explores the transition from initial ideas to piloted solutions. Speakers will share reflections on strategic objectives, approaches, challenges, and learnings. Gain a practical framework for implementing responsible, use-case-driven AI in the social sector, backed by real-world outcomes and lessons learned during the journey from concept to impact.
speakers: Erica Arya; Mainak Roy; Manohar Sreekanth; Pritam Sukumar; Steven Suting; Temina Madon
summary_one_liner: Seven NGOs share real AI pilot journeys from concept to impact
icebreaker: Seven NGOs shared real pilots—which sector's AI impact resonates most with your organization's mission?
networking_tip: Smaller crowd of mission-driven leaders: grab coffee with speakers like Erica Arya and Mainak Roy post-session for deeper conversations.

title: Panel Discussion: Reimagining AI and STEM Education for India's Next Generation
description: AI is poised to  accelerate India's economic growth, positioning the country to become a trillion-dollar digital economy by 2030,  by preparing the next generation to contribute meaningfully to Viksit Bharat. This session aims to explore best practices and evolving models in AI and STEM education across curriculum design, pedagogy, teacher capacity, and infrastructure with ethical, and inclusive use of AI at its core.
speakers: Dr Raj Kumar; Prateek Aggarwal; Sanjay Jain; Shri Narendra Bhooshan (IAS); Yashmit Kedia
summary_one_liner: Redesigning India's STEM education for an AI-powered economy
icebreaker: Shri Narendra Bhooshan's Viksit Bharat vision—how are you embedding AI literacy into your institution's curriculum?
networking_tip: Education policy makers cluster here: connect with K-12 principals and edtech founders during breaks to discuss scaling.

title: NextGen AI: Skills, Safety, and Social Value — technical mastery aligned with ethical standards.
description: Equip participants with practical AI skills and ethical frameworks to build socially beneficial systems. Through hands‑on labs, bias audits, explainability toolkits, and industry mentorship, the program blends technical training with governance and deployment best practices—culminating in portfolio-ready capstones that prioritize safety, fairness, and measurable social impact.
room: Hall No. 4 First Floor - Session Hall 3
speakers: Prof.(Dr.) Alok Pandey, Dean, O.P. Jindal Global University; Prof. Jawar Singh, IIT Patna; Dr. Sarabjot Singh Anand, Co-Founder, Tartras Data, Head-Sabudh Foundation ; Mr. Muraleedharan Manninqal, CEO, Information & Communication Technology Academy, Kerala ; Mr. Kunal Gupta, MD, Mount Talant Consulting Pvt. Ltd., Delhi ; Mr. Vikash Srivastava, Chief Growth Strategist, Vinsys IT Services (Pune)
summary_one_liner: Hands-on labs blend AI technical training with ethical deployment
icebreaker: Prof. Alok Pandey—how do capstone projects prepare students for industry?
networking_tip: Chat with industry mentors during lab sessions—they assess talent and hire from top-performing bootcamp graduates.

title: Fireside Chat
speakers: Børge Brende, President & CEO, World Economic Forum; Ashwini Vaishnaw, Minister for Railways, Information and Broadcasting & Electronics and Information Technology, Government of India; Siddharth Zarabi, Editor, Business Today
summary_one_liner: WEF President and India's IT Minister in marquee fireside chat
icebreaker: Børge Brende—how does WEF see AI shaping India's digital economy trajectory?
networking_tip: VCs and CXOs cluster post-fireside chat—have a 30-second pitch ready for growth-stage AI companies.

title: Keynote Session : Jeetu Patel, President and Chief Product Officer, Cisco Inc
summary_one_liner: Cisco's top product leader shares enterprise AI vision at plenary
icebreaker: Jeetu Patel—where is Cisco seeing the biggest enterprise AI pain points?
networking_tip: Network with Cisco's product team—they hire ML engineers and partner with emerging AI infrastructure startups.

title: Aligning AI Governance Across the Technology Stack
description: This high-level CXO panel will explore how AI governance frameworks can be aligned across the entire technology stack—from semiconductors and compute infrastructure to AI models, applications, and deployment. Panelists will discuss risk-based, interoperable approaches that support innovation while clearly defining roles across the AI value chain. The session will highlight practical governance challenges and opportunities for global coordination, with a focus on collaboration between like-minded partners.
speakers: Aparna Bawa; David Zapolsky; Jason Oxman; Jay Chaudhry
summary_one_liner: CXOs align risk-based AI governance from chips to applications
icebreaker: David Zapolsky and Jason Oxman on AI governance stacks—where's your org starting with risk-based regulation?
networking_tip: CXO panel with compliance leads: position yourself near chief legal officers; they drive governance budgets and partnerships.

title: AI Competitiveness through Regional Collaboration
description: This roundtable will convene senior leaders at stakeholders level for an informal strategic exchange on strengthening AI competitiveness at regional and global levels. The discussion will focus on widening access to sovereign AI capabilities while preserving national choice and policy autonomy, and using regional and international collaboration to reduce dependencies and increase resilience.
speakers: Børge Brende
summary_one_liner: WEF convenes leaders on sovereign AI and regional competitiveness
icebreaker: Børge Brende's regional AI competitiveness agenda—which geopolitical barriers is your nation tackling first?
networking_tip: Exclusive roundtable of heads of state and diplomats: this is relationship-building at scale—focus on 1-on-1 bilateral moments.

title: Responsible and Open AI for Shared Prosperity: South-South Pathways for Languages, Data, and Evaluation
description: This session explores how South–South partnerships are building inclusive AI ecosystems by expanding open, localized language datasets, shared evaluation frameworks, and locally governed innovation hubs. It will highlight the Masakhane African Language Hub as a pan-African model for scaling AI across 50+ languages, alongside India and Singapore's approaches to sovereign AI infrastructure. The discussion will showcase progress, funding commitments, and concrete next steps to advance equitable, real-world AI impact.
speakers: Chenai Chair; Dr. Fola Adeleke; Dr. Lesley Teo; Mr. Amitabh Nag; Mr. Rikin Gandhi
summary_one_liner: South-South partnerships build open multilingual AI ecosystems together
icebreaker: Rikin Gandhi on Masakhane—what language datasets are you prioritizing for your Global South AI ecosystem?
networking_tip: NLP researchers and policy makers mixed: connect with Dr. Fola Adeleke on open data governance—high-impact collaboration potential.

title: Catalyzing Global Investment for Equitable and Responsible AI in Health
description: This strategic roundtable will convene senior policymakers, development partners, and financing institutions to discuss approaches for strengthening and aligning investment in artificial intelligence for health. The session will examine current financing gaps, opportunities for coordinated and sustainable investment, and governance considerations to support responsible, equity-oriented AI adoption. Discussions will focus on enabling country-led priorities, strengthening health system foundations, and ensuring that AI contributes to safe, inclusive, and sustainable public health outcomes.
speakers: Alain Labrique; Catharina Boehma; Haitham Ali Ahmed El‑Noush; Justice Prathiba M. Singh; Ken-Ichiro Natsume; Payden P.; Prokar Dasgupta; Zameer Brey
summary_one_liner: WHO-led roundtable mobilizes global health AI investment and governance
icebreaker: Alain Labrique, what's the biggest gap you see in AI health investment right now?
networking_tip: Target the financing institution representatives early—they control deployment capital and need to hear from implementers.

title: High-level Panel Discussion on AI Bridges: India–Israel Innovation Dialogue
description: This high-level panel at the AI Impact Summit 2026 explores the strategic synergy between India and Israel. The session brings together stakeholders to examine opportunities for collaboration by integrating India's scale and technical talent with Israel's research and innovation ecosystem and governance approaches. The discussion will chart actionable pathways for collaboration across innovation, ethics, and market access, aiming to build a responsible, globally competitive AI ecosystem driven by the complementary strengths of both nations.
speakers: Erez Naftali Askal; Mr. Sanjay Kadaveru; Ms. Shira Lev Ami; Yoel Ben Or
summary_one_liner: India and Israel chart joint AI innovation and market access paths
icebreaker: Sanjay Kadaveru, which India-Israel AI synergies are founders missing right now?
networking_tip: Bilateral panels attract trade officials—pitch market access opportunities, not just technology.

title: AI and Intellectual Property: Building an Equitable Innovation Ecosystem
description: The session will explore India's strategic opportunity to shape global discourse on AI-IP governance, assess policy imperatives relating to AI-driven innovation, frontier model development, AI applications, and small-model innovation as highlighted in the Economic Survey 2026-27, and underscore India's development priorities supported by its strengthening digital ecosystem, an expanding startup base, and ongoing AI-related IP reforms.
speakers: Dr. Ulrike Till; Mr. Ameet Datta; Mr. Amit Kumar; Mr. Blaise Fernandes; Mr. Kenichiro Natsume; Mr. Mihir Rale; Mr. Munish Sudan; Mr. Munjal B. Shroff; Mr. Rajiv Aggarwal; Mr. Satyoki Koundinya
summary_one_liner: India shapes global AI intellectual property governance and reform
icebreaker: Munjal B. Shroff, how should founders navigate IP strategy in frontier AI models?
networking_tip: IP attorneys and patent officers here need clear startup use-case frameworks—prepare specific examples.

title: Leadership Dialogue on AI in Mobility: Accelerating the Future of Intelligent Transport
description: Leadership Dialogue on AI in Mobility: Accelerating the Future of Intelligent Transport
speakers: Dr Shiv Kumar
summary_one_liner: AI-powered intelligent transport is reshaping future urban mobility systems
icebreaker: Dr Shiv Kumar, what's blocking AI adoption in Indian smart cities right now?
networking_tip: Transport ministry and urban planners are key decision-makers—focus on infrastructure ROI, not tech features.

title:
Who Watches the Watchers? 
Exploring Independent Verification in AI Governance
description: This session explores how independent assurance, operationalized through a marketplace of Independent Verification Organizations, can create greater trust and adoption in artificial intelligence systems. The discussion brings together leading AI policymakers and experts from India, the United States, and other leading AI adopters to discuss mechanisms for realigning developer and deployer incentives with the public interest in each country context.
speakers: Dean Ball; Gregory C. Allen; Shana Mansbach
summary_one_liner: Independent verification can build public trust in AI systems
icebreaker: Gregory C. Allen, how are you defining 'independent verification' for real-world AI systems?
networking_tip: Compliance officers and policy researchers cluster here—position yourself as operationally feasible, not just theoretical.

title: AI governance in the Age of Powerful AI - IInternational Perspectives and the Code of Practice
description: Bringing perspectives from government, academia, industry, and civil society across regions, the session will explore how AI governance frameworks can support responsible innovation, and build shared trust in widely deployed AI systems. This panel will also introduce the Code of Practice for general-purpose AI models and examine its implications globally. The discussion will unpack requirements on transparency, copyright, and lifecycle risk management, including safeguards for advanced models with systemic impact.
speakers: Denise Wong; Henna Virkkunen; Lucilla Sioli; Sean Ó hÉigeartaigh; Yoshua Bengio
summary_one_liner: Global leaders debate governance frameworks for powerful general-purpose AI
icebreaker: Yoshua Bengio, what's your biggest concern about current AI governance frameworks?
networking_tip: Heavy-hitter panel attracts senior policy makers—ask substantive questions to stand out in Q&A.

title: Open Networks in the Global South
description: The session will explore how open digital networks and interoperable public infrastructure, supported by Artificial Intelligence, are transforming digital economies in the Global South. Drawing on experiences such as UPI and ONDC in India and emerging open networks. The discussion will focus on inclusive payments, commerce, and innovation for small merchants and consumers.
speakers: Mr. Aniket Doegar; Mr. Sachin Gopalan; Mr. Sujith Nair; Mr. T Koshy; Ms. Savita Muley
summary_one_liner: Open digital networks drive inclusive economic transformation across Global South
icebreaker: Aniket Doegar, how are open networks like ONDC impacting fintech investment decisions?
networking_tip: Development economists and GovTech officials attend—connect open infrastructure to measurable financial inclusion outcomes.

title: AI for Economic Growth and Social Good- Industry Synergies for Inclusive Innovation- Fireside Chat
description: AI for Economic Growth & Social Good: Industry Synergies for Inclusive Innovation is a high-level, solutions-oriented panel bringing together government, multilaterals, industry leaders, and innovation ecosystems to translate India's AI ambition into real-world impact. The session spotlights deployable AI use-cases across healthcare, agriculture, skilling, mobility, and financial inclusion, emphasizing responsible AI, blended finance, and cross-sector partnerships to scale beyond pilots toward measurable, population-level outcomes aligned with the IndiaAI Mission
speakers: Archana; Dr. Angela Lusigi; Priyanka Ravala; Rekha Srinivasan; Yosuke Sato
summary_one_liner: Translating India's AI ambition into real-world inclusive impact at scale
icebreaker: Angela Lusigi, where's the biggest opportunity for blended finance in inclusive AI innovation?
networking_tip: Development agencies and impact investors are both here—frame your ask around co-investment structures.

title: Peace, Power and Perspectives: A Value-Based Approach to Trustworthy AI
description: This session aims to examine the strategic role of Sovereign AI in strengthening India's national security and internal security frameworks. It will explore how indigenous AI capabilities enhance defence preparedness, cyber resilience, space and border surveillance, and policing operations, while augmenting human decision-making. The discussion will also address emerging security domains, counter-terror financing, deepfake detection, and the role of public–private collaboration in building secure, self-reliant AI systems aligned with India's 2026 reform vision.
speakers: Amlan Mohanty; Heather Broomfield; Hildegunn McLernon; Karianne Oldernes Tung; Mala Wang-Naveen; Morten Dæhlen; Niels Nagelhus Schia; Roberto Viola; Yoshimasa Uno
summary_one_liner: Sovereign AI strengthens national security and trustworthy defense frameworks
icebreaker: Roberto Viola, how should sovereign AI strategy balance security with open innovation?
networking_tip: Defense and diplomatic officials dominate—speak to threat prevention and bilateral advantage, not just technology.

title: Standards as Strategy: Accelerating AI Market Growth
description: This discussion examines how AI standards simultaneously reduce risk and create business value. As AI capabilities advance, many markets face deployment barriers not from technical limitations but from reliability concerns and broader trust deficits. Robust standards, backed by rigorous evaluation, can unlock market potential. This panel convenes leaders from AI standards and governance organizations alongside industry and policy executives to examine how effective standards enable economic growth, market confidence, and responsible governance.
speakers: Amanda Craig; Balaraman Ravindran; Chris Meserole; Esther Tetruashvily; Owen Larter; Rebecca Weiss; Rohit Israni
summary_one_liner: Robust AI standards unlock market growth and enterprise deployment confidence
icebreaker: Balaraman Ravindran, which AI standards actually reduce deployment barriers in production?
networking_tip: Enterprise AI and product leaders here need proof of market adoption—bring real implementation case studies.

title: Keynote Session : Cristiano Amon, President and Chief Executive Officer, Qualcomm
summary_one_liner: Qualcomm CEO shares vision for AI-powered computing's next era
icebreaker: Cristiano Amon—how is Qualcomm enabling on-device AI at scale?
networking_tip: Connect with hardware engineers—chip companies actively scout edge AI startups for integration partnerships.

title: Shaping Resilient Futures in the Age of AI: Leadership for the Technology, Energy, and Security Transitions
description: The ability of countries, regions, and alliances to thrive amid geopolitical volatility and systemic shocks depends on aligning three domains: AI and strategic technologies, diversified low-carbon energy systems, and modernised security capabilities. Rather than advancing in isolation, these pillars must progress together, at speed and scale, to strengthen economic and societal resilience. This discussion explores the "triple transition," outlining practical pathways to navigate it while promoting cooperation, accountability, and public trust globally.
speakers: Mr. Ashwani Sharma; Mr. Sanket Verma; Ms. Mala Kumar; Ms. Tarunima Prabakhar
summary_one_liner: Navigating the triple transition of AI, energy, and security simultaneously
icebreaker: How are you thinking about AI's role in your region's energy transition?
networking_tip: This covers 3 complex domains—find 1-2 speakers beforehand and ask them to connect you with others.

title: Responsible AI: From Principles to Practice in Corporate India
description: The panel will explore how organisations can move beyond high-level frameworks and embed Responsible AI into enterprise strategy, governance models, operating practices, and decision-making. Panellists will share leadership perspectives on what it takes to implement Responsible AI at scale — from policy benchmarks, boardroom ownership to organisational readiness, operating models and culture.  The objective would be to enable a more uniform and actionable approach to Responsible AI adoption across Corporate India.
speakers: Amol Deshpande; Andy Parsons; Dr. Satya Ramaswamy; Prativa Mohapatra; Shantheri Mallaya; Vishal Kanvaty
summary_one_liner: Enterprise playbook for embedding responsible AI into corporate India strategy
icebreaker: Dr. Satya Ramaswamy—how is Adobe moving responsible AI from principles into actual workflows?
networking_tip: 6 panelists mean rapid-fire insights. Take notes on speakers' companies and follow up post-event.

title: AI and the New Frontier for Economic Progress: Linking Innovation to Inclusive Growth
description: This panel discussion will highlight the potential of AI-led economic transformation to enable sustained growth, particularly in the Global South.  Panelists will also highlight risks of economic divides, labor displacement and other adverse social impact. The session will help identify the roles of governments, private enterprises and development institutions working together to align technological innovation with inclusive economic transformation.
speakers: Anu Bradford; Iqbal Singh Dhaliwal; Jeanette Rodrigues; Johannes Zutt; Michael Kremer; Ufuq Akcigit
summary_one_liner: World Bank and Nobel laureate discuss AI-driven inclusive growth strategies
icebreaker: Michael Kremer, what labor displacement risks concern you most for the Global South?
networking_tip: World Bank officials and dev economists cluster here—ask pointed policy questions to stand out.

title: Mobilizing AI for the Collective Good
description: With a focus on India and the UK, this panel discussion, featuring academics, politicians, industrialists, and non-profit practitioners will discuss the opportunities for AI to be mobilized collectively, in ways that benefit all citizens, and existing barriers that need to be overcome.
speakers: Antaraa Vasudev; Dr. Nirav Ajmeri; Janhavi Pawar; Kushe Bahl; Prof. D. Manjunath; Prof. Seth Bullock
summary_one_liner: India-UK collaboration to mobilize AI for citizen benefit and equity
icebreaker: Prof. D. Manjunath, how can civic tech actually scale equitable AI in India?
networking_tip: Mixed crowd (academics, NGOs, politicians)—identify your sector early and find peer practitioners.

title: Edge AI in Action: Accelerating Development across the Global South
description: As AI evolves, the shift from centralized cloud computing to edge AI is transforming how data is processed and acted upon. By moving intelligence closer to data sources such as sensors, mobile devices, and IoT systems, edge AI reduces latency, bandwidth usage, and energy consumption while improving real-time decision-making, privacy, and security. Real-world applications will be highlighted along with emerging lightweight and generative AI models designed for resource-constrained edge environments.
speakers: Alagan Mahalingam; Dr. Ranjitha Prasad; Dr. Rathinamala Vijay; Frederic Werner; H.E Amb Lavina Ramkissoon; Prof Brejesh Lall; Vinesh Sukumar; Vishnu Ram OV
summary_one_liner: Edge AI transforms real-time processing for resource-constrained Global South
icebreaker: Which edge AI use case in the Global South do you think solves the hardest real problem?
networking_tip: 8 speakers signal deep technical depth—connect with IoT/embedded engineers during Q&A.

title: Preparing the Future: AI-Driven Strategies for Workforce and Economic Growth
description: AI can accelerate economic growth by improving efficiency and enabling new forms of innovation. Preparing for the future means treating AI not just as an automation tool, but as a strategic partner for productivity and growth. By 2030, AI adoption across sectors such as manufacturing, healthcare and finance is expected to add trillions to the global economy. As organizations integrate AI, careers increasingly combine machine speed and accuracy with human judgment, empathy, and contextual understanding.
speakers: Mr BVR Subramaniyam; Mr Chandrajit Banerjee; Mr Puneet Chandok; Mr Rajeev Memani; Ms Debjani Ghosh; Ms Ipsita Dasgupta; Rajan R. Navani
summary_one_liner: Industry giants chart workforce transformation strategy for India's AI era
icebreaker: Ms. Debjani Ghosh, how are CII members actually re-skilling workers for AI-era roles?
networking_tip: CHROs and skilling leaders dominate—discuss workforce transition gaps in breakout conversations.

title: AI-Ready Data: Shared Infrastructure for Innovation
description: Data is the backbone of AI innovation. This session focuses on how interoperable, trustworthy, and consent-based data infrastructure can enable AI development while protecting user rights. Speakers will discuss governance frameworks, data-sharing models, and public–private collaboration approaches.
speakers: Dr Debabrata Das; Dr. V K Paul; Mitesh Khapra; Prem Ramaswami; Shalini Kapoor
summary_one_liner: Interoperable data infrastructure as the backbone for India's AI innovation
icebreaker: Dr. V K Paul, how can consent-based data infrastructure actually scale in India?
networking_tip: Data governance + privacy = niche crowd. Connect directly with gov data officers during breaks.

title: Enabling Global Enterprise AI Adoption for Impact
description: A practical, impact-focused discussion on how enterprise AI can deliver measurable gains in productivity, service quality, and inclusive growth. Through real-world global use cases, participants will gain insights into scaling AI adoption across diverse markets, with a focus on workforce skilling, infrastructure, and data readiness. The session will surface actionable lessons, partnership models, and implementation requirements to move from pilot projects to sustainable, replicable AI solutions, particularly in emerging market contexts.
speakers: Danielle Johnson-Kutch; Dr. Jared Ragland; Dr. Lovneesh Chanana; Mr. Chandler Morse; Mr. Combiz Richard Abdolrahimi; Mr. David Masters; Mr. Jace Johnson; Mr. Josh Kallmer; Mr. Mike Haley; Mr. Sam Kaplan
summary_one_liner: Practical enterprise AI scaling lessons from diverse global markets
icebreaker: Which emerging market AI adoption case study surprised you most with ROI speed?
networking_tip: 10 speakers from BSA mean enterprise focus—target CIOs during networking sections, not speeches.

title: AI and Children's Safety and Wellbeing
description: Children are becoming among the earliest and most intensive users of AI, often before safeguards and regulations are fully in place. This session asks a direct question: how can AI be shaped to strengthen children's safety and wellbeing rather than undermine them? Drawing on technology leaders, child-rights experts, and a young AI innovator, the discussion examines advancing innovation, where risks demand firm limits, and how trust in AI can be built for the next generation.
speakers: Amandeep Singh Gill; Chris Lehane; Joanna Shields; Maria Bielikova; Megan Garcia; Raul John Aju; Thomas Davin; Tom Hall; Urvashi Aneja
knowledge_partners: United Nations Office for Digital and Emerging Technologies
summary_one_liner: Safeguarding children in the AI age with firm guardrails and innovation
icebreaker: Chris Lehane, how should platforms balance child safety with AI innovation access?
networking_tip: High-conviction crowd on safety. Connect with trust & safety leads and child advocates between sessions.

title: Realizing the Health Value of AI - Safely
description: AI is transforming health in unprecedented ways, but progress only matters when it is safe, trusted, and built for people. At the India AI Impact Summit 2026, we are convening a focused conversation on how AI can responsibly deliver real health value. From global health systems to frontline impact, this session brings together leaders at the intersection of science, data, and care to turn AI's promise into measurable health outcomes.
speakers: Dr. Monika Sharma; Dr. Richard Rukwata; Dr. Trevor Mundel; Minister Paula Ingabire; Professor Charlotte Watts; Vikalp Sahni
summary_one_liner: Gates Foundation convenes leaders to deliver safe AI-driven health outcomes
icebreaker: Dr. Sharma, what's the biggest safety challenge you're seeing in clinical AI deployments across different health systems?
networking_tip: Arrive early to connect with Gates Foundation reps and clinical researchers before the high-density speaker panel dominates the room.

title: AI for Inclusive Societal Development
description: Advancing AI systems that are inclusive by design, empowering diverse communities and ensuring equitable representation
speakers: Nikhil Kolur; S. Anjani Kumar
summary_one_liner: Designing AI systems that empower diverse communities by default
icebreaker: How is Deloitte approaching inclusive AI design differently for different regions represented here?
